e



T H o0 e
Summary



18.

19.

20.

d. Access to the central business district including particularly
Charles Center, the Civic Center and the retail trade center
Benefits to the major trucking and distribution firms within the
City

Benefits to the port

Possible blighting effect on adjacent areas

Number and quality of dwellings to be demolished

Effect on assessed valuations

Amount of vacant land required which would be otherwise suit-
able for industrial development.

There would appear to be no decisive difference between the North-
ern Route and the Harbor Route with respect to total cost or
important properties to be taken.

For reasons which are summarized in Chapter X the Planning Com-
mission recommends that the East-West Expressway be constructed
along the Harbor Route, that the inner ring be completed substan-
tially as proposed in this report, and that further study be given to an
expressway connection between the Jones Falls Expressway and the
northeast section of the City.

o

St th

To effect these recommendations the Planning Commission proposes

that:

a. An engineering study be undertaken of the Harbor Route and
the completion of the inner ring to verify structural feasibility,
to estimate costs, and to determine accurate taking lines,

b. A design team be created having staff representation from the
various public agencies and departments involved, and

c. If the report on engincering feasibility is favorable, City Council
endorsement of the East-West Expressway along the Harbor
Route be requested as soon thereafter as possible.

=B
